Interface ec.encoding.Decoder

public interface interface Decoder
A Decoder is an object which is capable of instantiating other objects based on preface args. They are the thing stuck into EncodedObjects which encapsulate the "recipe" for decoding. Decoders hand back DecodeResults, which can then subsequently be handed body args. The general process of decoding an EncodedObject, eo, is:
  • DecodeResult dr = eo.getDecoder ().decode (prefaceArgs);
  • Put dr.getInstance () in an appropriate mapping table.
  • Call dr.decodeBody (bodyArgs);
A Decoder may choose to return a StopDecoding from decode(); this kind of DecodeResult represents an object which is fully instantiated after having merely processed the preface arguments. A Decoder might also choose to return a ContinueDecoding; this would likely be done if the Decoder is a StandardDecoder. (See StandardDecoder for further details.)

See Also:
ContinueDecoding, DecodeResult, StandardDecoder, StopDecoding

decode(Object[])
Get a DecodeResult for an object based on the given preface arguments.

decode 
 public abstract DecodeResult decode(Object prefaceArgs[])
Get a DecodeResult for an object based on the given preface arguments.
